""Job Title: Full Stack DeveloperWe are seeking a talented and experienced Fullstack Developer to join our development team and play a crucial role in designing, building, and maintaining our applications. ""I did setup below configurations..however some lambda code needs to be reviewed/write new one as per the output requiredThe project involves creating an AWS-based solution that automatically processes files uploaded to an S3 bucket, leveraging AWS Lambda, Amazon Simple Queue Service (SQS), and DynamoDB. The process is designed to decouple components for scalability and reliability. Here's an outline of the project:1. ObjectiveAutomatically process files uploaded to an Amazon S3 bucket.Log processing results in an Amazon DynamoDB table for tracking and auditability.2. ComponentsAmazon S3: Object storage service to store uploaded files.Amazon SQS: Message queuing service to decouple the file upload event from the processing logic.AWS Lambda: Serverless compute service to process files and log results.Amazon DynamoDB: NoSQL database service to store records of processed files.3. WorkflowFile Upload:Files are uploaded to a designated S3 bucket.Event Notification:S3 bucket is configured to send an event notification to an SQS queue whenever a new file is uploaded.Message Queuing:The SQS queue receives messages containing details about the uploaded files.Lambda Function Trigger:The AWS Lambda function is triggered by messages in the SQS queue.File Processing:The Lambda function processes the file. Processing could involve reading the file, transforming data, extracting information, etc.Logging to DynamoDB:After processing the file, the Lambda function logs details (e.g., file name, processing status, timestamp) to a DynamoDB table.4. Implementation StepsSetup AWS Services:Create an S3 bucket for file uploads.Set up an SQS queue to receive notifications from the S3 bucket.Create a DynamoDB table to log processing details.Configure IAM roles and permissions for access control.Configure S3 Event Notifications:Set up the S3 bucket to publish events to the SQS queue on file uploads.Develop Lambda Function:Write the Lambda function code to process files and log to DynamoDB.Ensure error handling and logging are in place for debugging and monitoring.Deploy and Test:Deploy the Lambda function and configure it to be triggered by the SQS queue.Test the end-to-end workflow by uploading files to the S3 bucket and verifying entries in the DynamoDB table.Monitoring and Optimization:Use CloudWatch to monitor the operation, including the execution of the Lambda function and the SQS queue behavior.Optimize performance and cost based on metrics and logs.Budget: $20Posted On: February 13, 2024 17:56 UTCCategory: Scripting & AutomationSkills:Amazon S3, Python, Amazon Web Services, AWS LambdaSkills: Amazon S3, Python, Amazon Web Services, AWS LambdaCountry: India""
